intro: Evea tontaneoides, commonly known as the Tontaneoides evergreen, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forest regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
